intro: Jacobaea insubrica, commonly known as the Alpine groundsel, is a flowering plant native to the alpine regions of Europe. It is characterized by its low-growing habit, with dark green, woolly leaves and yellow flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant thrives in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to cold, high-altitude environments. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is known for its ability to withstand harsh climatic conditions. Jacobaea insubrica is often found in mountain meadows and is a symbol of resilience in extreme environments.
